security: Revealing that FBIS is using student action along lines of racist attitudes, tying the incident to congo expulsion and long range plan to dupe African states by means of subversion, student indoctrination and economic aid, would expose methods of intelligence gathering and possible CIA influence.
summary: A classified message reports on a protest by African students in Moscow over the alleged killing of a Ghanaian student and suggests using the incident to highlight racist attitudes and Soviet subversion in Africa.
summary_one_paragraph: This classified message, dated December 19, 1963, reports on approximately five hundred African students protesting in Moscow at the Ghana embassy and Kremlin due to the alleged killing of a Ghanaian student, Asaro Addeo. The message outlines how FBIS (Foreign Broadcast Information Service) sources plan to leverage the incident to highlight alleged racist attitudes in the Soviet Union, link it to the Congo expulsion of Soviet diplomats, and portray it as part of a broader Soviet scheme to subvert and control naive African states through indoctrination, economic aid, and political manipulation. The message directs recipients to watch student groups for demonstrations and interview communist-trained students and government officials for reaction, with instructions to send relevant clippings to HQS.
title: African Student Protest in Moscow
